thread.title: Honda scores as Japan moves atop group in Asian qualifiers
thread.title_full: Honda scores as Japan moves atop group in Asian qualifiers | Boston Herald

author: Associated Press
title: Honda scores as Japan moves atop group in Asian qualifiers
text:
SEOUL, South Korea â€” AC Milan's Keisuke Honda and Leicester City's Shinji Okazaki scored second-half goals to give Japan a 3-0 win over Syria on Thursday and top spot in Group E in the second round of Asian World Cup qualifiers.
After a frustrating first half in Oman, where Syria plays its home games for security reasons, Japan lifted the intensity after the break.
Japan took the lead soon early in the second half after Okazaki was fouled in the area. Honda stroked home the spot kick and Okazaki scored from close range soon after to make it 2-0. Former Bayern Munich forward Takashi Usami sealed the win late in the game.
"We knew this would be a tough game for us," Japan's Bosnian coach Vahid Halilhodzic said after the game. "We came through it and now can look forward to the next challenge."
The win puts Japan a point clear of Syria at the halfway stage of the eight-game round. Singapore is two points behind Syria in third following a 1-0 win over Afghanistan.
It was an encouraging night overall for southeast Asian football. Iraq needed a 95th-minute penalty from Younis Mahmoud to salvage a Vietnam 1-1 draw in Hanoi and move two points behind Group F leader Thailand.
North Korea's winning streak in World Cup qualifying came to an end with a 0-0 draw against the Philippines.
The North Koreans lead Group H with 10 points from four games.
In Group A, an injury-time goal from Abu Nahyeh gave Palestine a 1-1 draw against East Timor. Turkmenistan defeated India 2-1, Maldives defeated Bhutan 4-3 and Lebanon beat Myanmar 2-0.
The top team from each of the eight groups and the best four second-place teams advance to the next round of qualifying.
